intro.description: This Tutorial will show you how to get a first look at diffraction images to asses their general quality

item.title: Open DIVA Perspective
item.description: The DIVA perspective is designed to make looking at diffraction images as easy as possible.

item.title: Open a Diffraction Image
item.description:
Use the Project Explorer, open the data project and the examples folder within it.
Then select the first .img image. You will see the Metadata information appear in the Metadata view just below the navigator.
Now double click on the selected .img file and you will see the image appear in the MX image editor in the middle of the window.

item.title: Navigating around the image
item.description:
Move the mouse over to the MX image editor which shows the diffraction image and experiment with the following tools which are available to allow you to look around the image.
Scroll Wheel
Zoom in and out of the image
The Panning tool
This is the tool selected by default, so just click on the image and drag it around to pan.
Finally to get information about where you are pointing at specifically, activate the Pixel information tool which can be found in the toolbar directly above the image -- it's in the Image tools drop-down and the tool-tip reads 'Image tools used to profile and inspect images'.
With this turned on, information can be found out about the image by moving the mouse pointer over it. The information is displayed in a new view that opens up.

item.title: Changing the colour scale on the image
item.description:
Sometimes to get the best out of the data, changing the way the pixel values are mapped to a specific colour can really help.
There is lots of functionality available here, but the easiest way to see a variety of different mappings is to use the Colour mapping tool in the Image tools drop-down. Select a different colour scheme, Try a few different ones, but then end up on 'Sqrt scale' which can be useful for pulling data out of the lower regions on the image.

item.title: Resolution Rings
item.description:
To see resolution rings on the image, use the tools in the Resolution rings drop-down. This allows various markers to be set on the image, including standards and ice rings.
First, select the Beam Centre tool, which will show a point on the image which is where the metadata puts the beam centre.
Now click on Standard rings to get a set of resolution rings, the values of which are displayed as labels on the rings.
